Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can illustrate a plant that has received enough water, depicting it with green leaves and an upright posture, indicating health.
The student can illustrate a plant that has not received enough water, showing it with drooping leaves and a wilted posture, indicating it is unhealthy.
The student can demonstrate the difference between a healthy plant with sufficient water and an unhealthy plant without water through clear visual contrasts in their drawings.
CANNOT: The student might occasionally miss small details, such as failing to accurately represent the texture of leaves or missing small droops on leaves in the wilting plant.

The student may partially explain why plants need water using their drawings, but might not fully articulate the biological process of water helping plants to maintain structure and transport nutrients.
